question: 敷く
userAnswer: to{} spread-out/lay-out | pave/cover/strew | lay-(railway-tracks) | sit-on | take-a-position | impose-widely
activeAnswer: to{} spread-out/lay-out | pave/cover/strew | lay-(railway-tracks) | sit-on | take-a-position | impose-widely
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>spread</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to spread out</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to lay out</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: What is getting <vocabulary>spread out</vocabulary>? <reading>Shee</reading>p (<ja>し</ja>)! Someone's been hunting sheep, because you're looking at a bunch of empty (dead) sheep bodies spread out on the ground.
